results.t: RANK definition in American English - Collins Dictionary

results.p: 1. a : relative standing or position b : a degree or position of dignity, eminence, or excellence : distinction soon took rank as a leading attorney.

results.t: RANK | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: a position in an organization, such as the army, showing the importance of the person having it: senior/high/junior/low rank
A rank is a position in a hierarchy. It can be formally recognized—for example, cardinal, chief executive officer, general, professor—or unofficial.
This article describes the formula syntax and usage of the RANK function in Microsoft Excel. Description. Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers.
The word rank often deals with one's position or status in a group. In the military, an officer with a high rank will be in charge of soldiers of lower rank.
a social or official position or standing, as in the armed forces: the rank of captain. high position or station in the social or some similar scale.

results.t: RANK definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: Someone's rank is the position or grade that they have in an organization. He eventually rose to the rank of captain.
RANK meaning: 1 : a position in a society, organization, group, etc.; 2 : a high position in a society, organization, group, etc. usually used after of.
A ranking is a relationship between a set of items, often recorded in a list, such that, for any two items, the first is either "ranked higher than", "ranked ...
